author: protolambda
content:
https://eth2stats.io/schlesi-testnet/map
Running 4x lighthouse and 4x prysm. Now onwards to adding 4x teku ðŸ™‚

author: nishant0
content: nice

author: nishant0
content: whats the setup to manage all the nodes like ?

author: protolambda
content: Ansible to provision machines to different regions (and different cloud providers in the future, just aws now), and then "parties": groups of nodes, tagged with a testnet also

author: protolambda
content: Each remote runs docker, and ansible script takes my party configs and manages the docker containers for various things (validator, beacon, eth2stats, etc)

author: protolambda
content: I had dokku previously as well, to git-push these apps running on the remote, but it caused more devops problems than it was good for.

author: nishant0
content: nice, seems like provisioning multiple nodes isn't an issue. Although setting up nodes in different regions and spreading them out equally seems complicated

author: protolambda
content: That's the easiest part honestly. Cloud providers with ansible api are easy. Although with a kubernetes approach it would probably be a nightmare to have them under multiple regions yes.

author: ajsutton
content: Nice, I'd tried it on a raspberry pi on the weekend for fun but had installed Raspbian which I later realised was only 32bit.  Will have to try again with ubuntu.  I can now see why ipv6 isn't working, hopefully will have a fix up for review soon.
